ver.title: VER - Version
ver.body: Simple command that prints WebBrew version.

cd.title: CD - Change Directory
cd.body:
Changes your current working directory to <DIRECTORY>. 

 To go one directory up, do "cd .."
 To go to the root directory, do "cd /"
 CD supports both relative (dir/) and absolute (/tmp/dir/) paths.

debug_wbsh.title: debug_wbsh - Debug Commands
debug_wbsh.body:
NOTE TO DEVS: REMOVE THIS BEFORE PUBLIC RELEASE (NOT BETA RELEASE)

 Runs <COMMAND> from the list of debug commands.

 DEBUG COMMANDS: 
 shout: prints SH_Output variable

disks.title: DISKS - List Disks
disks.body:
Shows all currently mounted disks.
 Use change <DISK> to open a disk.

format.title: FORMAT - Format Disk
format.body:
&c 255,0,0 c&*WARNING* DESTRUCTIVE OPERATION! USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!&c 255,255,255 c&
 Formats (clears) a disk.
 This will remove all files and folders from a disk.
 Make sure you're deleting the correct disk to prevent data loss.

get.title: GET - Download File
get.body: Downloads <FILENAME> from your WebBrew disk to your hard drive.

ls.title: LS - List Directory
ls.body: Shows all files and directories in the current working directory.

man.title: MAN - Command Manual
man.body:
The WebBrew Command Manual provides manual pages for every loaded command.
 These pages provide helpful information on how to use a command and its syntax

 Running "man <COMMAND>" will show <COMMAND>'s manual page.
 Running "man" by itself will give you a directory of categories.

mkdir.title: MKDIR - Make Directory
mkdir.body: Makes a directory (folder) called <NAME> in the current working directory

mount.title: MOUNT - Mount Disk
mount.body:
Mounts the provided disk.
 If the disk does not exist, it will create it.
 To change into a mounted disk, use "change <DISK>".

mv.title: MV - Move File
mv.body: Moves <FILE1> to the new location of <FILE2>.

post.title: POST - Upload File
post.body: Upload a file from your hard drive to the current working directory.

pwd.title: PWD - Print Working Directory
pwd.body: Prints your current working directory (current directory your terminal is on).

rm.title: RM - Remove File/Directory
rm.body:
Removes the file or directory <PATH>.
 If directory provided has files or directories inside, you wont be able to remove it.
 "rmdir <PATH>" does'nt have this restriction.

rmdir.title: RMDIR - Remove Recursive Directory
rmdir.body:
Removes the directory <PATH>.
 Can remove directories with files or directories inside.

unmount.title: UNMOUNT - Unmount Disk
unmount.body: Unmounts <ejects/closes> the provided disk. Remount it with "mount <DISK>"

wget.title: WGET - Upload File From URL
wget.body: Uploads a file from provided url to the current working directory.

reboot.title: REBOOT - Reload Terminal
reboot.body: Reloads and reboots the terminal (sends you back to your bootloader).
